evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiff Jane Doe is a 21-year-old transgender woman who has been diagnosed with gender dysphoria, a serious medical condition that requires treatment.

extracted.value: Jane Doe is a 21‑year‑old transgender woman diagnosed with gender dysphoria.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane is a dependent of her father, John Doe, who served for more than 23 years in the Marine Corps and Air Force.

extracted.value: Jane is a dependent of her father, John Doe, a veteran with more than 23 years of service in the Marine Corps and Air Force.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane’s father, Plaintiff John Doe, retired from the U.S. military as a Senior Master Sergeant after more than 23 years of honorable service in both the Marine Corps and Air Force.

extracted.value: Jane’s father is a Senior Master Sergeant who retired after more than 23 years of honorable service.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: John Doe is considered the “TRICARE Sponsor” for Jane.

extracted.value: Jane’s father is an eligible TRICARE sponsor.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Despite Jane’s eligibility and her father’s honorable service, Jane has been denied critical treatments recommended by her doctors solely because of a federal statute dating to 1976, 10 U.S. C. Sec. 1079 (a)(11), that mandates the categorical exclusion of all surgical treatments for gender transition in the military’s medical coverage for eligible dependents of servicemembers.

extracted.value: Jane has been denied TRICARE coverage for gender‑affirming treatments under 10 U.S.C. §1079.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane was referred to an endocrinologist for this treatment and began her prescribed medication of testosterone blockers and estrogen in 2018.

extracted.value: Jane began hormone replacement therapy (HRT) in 2018 after being referred to an endocrinologist.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2018 and 2019, upon the recommendation of her doctors, Jane sought coverage for medically necessary laser hair removal and electrolysis to eliminate visible male facial hair.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: These treatments were denied coverage by TRICARE.

extracted.value: Jane underwent laser hair removal and electrolysis in 2018‑2019, which were denied coverage by TRICARE.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2019 and 2021, Jane underwent facial feminization and voice feminization surgeries recommended by her doctors for her gender transition.

extracted.value: Jane had facial feminization surgery in 2019 and voice feminization surgery in 2021.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2021, Jane’s doctors determined that a vaginoplasty is medically necessary surgical treatment for her gender dysphoria.

extracted.value: In 2021, Jane’s doctors determined a vaginoplasty is medically necessary.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane sought authorization through TRICARE to consult with a surgeon regarding her prescribed vaginoplasty. Defendants denied authorization for even a consultation for this gender‑transition surgery.

extracted.value: Jane sought TRICARE authorization for a vaginoplasty consultation and was denied.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane incurred a substantial portion of the cost of these surgeries that she would not have had to pay if they had been properly covered by her TRICARE benefits. Jane subsequently sought reimbursement from TRICARE for these costs, but TRICARE denied her claim and her subsequent appeals.

extracted.value: Jane incurred out‑of‑pocket costs for her surgeries and was denied reimbursement by TRICARE.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Although assigned the sex of male at birth, Jane, who was born in 2001, has known that she is female since age 11 or 12. Jane was diagnosed with gender dysphoria at age 17 in 2018.

extracted.value: Jane was born in 2001, knows she is female since age 11/12, and was diagnosed with gender dysphoria at age 17 in 2018.
